snippet: Israelis paved the way for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to lead a right-leaning and religious coalition that could be easier to control.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu's clear win in nation's election has strengthened his position as leader of right-leaning and purely conservative coalition but insiders say he is now likely to take certain liberties; without government's center-left factions to force him to ease his hardline position on Palestinian situation, Netanyahu may well soften his stance on issue.
lead_paragraph: Israelis paved the way for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to lead a right-leaning and religious coalition that could be easier to control.

headline.sub: Coalition Expected to Include Conservative Parties
headline.main: Win in Israel Sets Netanyahu on Path to Rebuild and Redefine Government
headline.print_headline: Decisive Win in Israel Sets Netanyahu on Path to Rebuild and Redefine
